subject: Politics
title: The Semiconductor Race
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Semiconductor Race.

hook.text: Taiwan makes 90% of the world's advanced chips. If China takes Taiwan, it controls the digital economy.

buildup.text: Semiconductors power everything: phones, cars, weapons, and AI. They're the most strategic resource of our era.

discovery.text: TSMC in Taiwan is irreplaceable. No other company can make the most advanced chips at scale.

twist.text: The US passed the CHIPS Act to bring chip manufacturing home. But building fabs takes years and billions.

climax.text: China is pouring money into chip independence. The US is trying to keep China a generation behind in chip tech.

punchline.text: Tiny chips, enormous stakes. Control them and you control the future.

quiz.question: Why is Taiwan so strategically important in the semiconductor industry?
options: TSMC in Taiwan makes 90% of the world's most advanced chips
Taiwan has the largest silicon deposits in the world
Taiwan invented the first computer chip
